channel.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
channel.description:
Curious if there is a patch inbound for the various issues being reported? If so whats the immediate focus?
The 2 biggest issues I am seeing are performance (especially the least level) and game balance. The balance can be manually changed by the user, so I am not sure if it is going to be considered an issue or not.
The more minor issues I think are the need to jump crouch for everything and the lack of DX8 support (which I am not sure will even be addressed).
Are there other issues people are seeing?

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?

item.description:
They didn’t release the SDK for free.

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: ThePsycho
item.description:
apologize for using the wrong word since I’m confused with the wording used in this article as well: https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Source_2009

how should I say it correctly? I didn’t say Valve released “Source Engine source code”, what I meant to say was… uh… k nvm forget it, can’t get the wording right.

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: elivance
item.description:
ThePsycho:

yeah because for some reason Valve still not release the source code of 2009 Source to modders yet.
with Black Mesa getting greenlit though, I guess Valve might assist them with that.

Valve didn’t and won’t release the source code of its engine.
Has been released a Source SDK, don’t spread false informations!

Black mesa on Source 2009?
At this point of development, I seriously doubt that this is gonna happen!

By the way,

Source License= a bucket of cash.
Patch ETA=Steam release ETA, probably.

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: Joe_Freeman
item.description:
Yeah at Easy you won’t have problems defeating the HECU because they do no damage. But they will hit you everytime they shoot and that sucks eventhough they don’t kill you, because then you feel like you’re a fucking invincible robot and not a person. So it would be better to make them less accurate.

Actually that’s the only problem I’ve found so far.

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: Dragunov2
item.description:
ThePsycho:

It wasn’t working properly in OB/2007 Source version. It only works on Left 4 Dead onward (and other games were ported to 2009 Source which has proper multicore supports already).

Loading the mod in the new Source is challenging I guess

Read full topic

item.description:
Bjossi:

It would be handy to have a central bug list thread where one can see all community-reported bugs/problems.

The Bug tracker takes care of that.

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: ThePsycho
item.description:
Dotard:

Instead of making a new thread, I will post and ask here… how is it that “multi-core rendering” isn’t working? Thought that comes with the OB version of Source

It wasn’t working properly in OB/2007 Source version. It only works on Left 4 Dead onward (and other games were ported to 2009 Source which has proper multicore supports already).

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: Chumbuster
item.description:
Loved it absolutely. I played it on easy as i do most shooters, they get abit rediculous on the harder settings ive found. I want it to feel like bullets, not ruber bullets with maybe slight lead coating.this is what it feels like on Hard, if u get me.

At first i was abit iffy about the whole sounds and things chanhged but it grew on me fast. I remember putting in some code into one of the files people suggested on the forums was only a couple lines and did seem to make the soldiers more human like. Something to do with making the soldiers respect site cone or something.

Anyway i didnt noticeto much difference. I liked their BOT AI and amazes me to this day how ai is made. Counterstrike bots are pretty smart i reckon, really love their ai.

By the end of the game when the credits rolled i nearly sheda tear or 2. Thats cos i played Half - Life 1 in year 7 at high school. My friend and i loved it and talked about it every day at school abut our last played thru,untill we finnished it. We’d help each other out with clues of how to get past the next bit. One of us might be stuck in certain bits. One bit i missed was the scientist whos hanging onto the train platform near the start of the game. My friend told me to go look out the front door when u get back to the main entrance…You had to break a keypad to open the door. Now its auto open door a guard and he just falls, oldschool bit was way a scientist and as u walked ontothe station platform to try maybe save him the platform would start to collapse and the scientist would say "No ! - Stay Back! … GORDON !!! RAAAAHHHH!!! and fall to his death… made me laugh every time.

Cant wait for a patch release made by the devs if it even needs it. Im not gonna stuff round with user made change that have no idea what they doin. I just cant wait for some more half life fun. The Episodes are ok but somehow not as cool to me as the Original.

Thumbs upto the mod team u have givin mehope in life again just by playing your great game. Thank You All. Fans too

PS Would love to seea few things thrown into the knoocks and crannies. Some extra doors openable with somethn in there. And more physics puzzles… PHYSICS PUZZLES PEOPLE !

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?

item.description:
OnboardError:

I think we will address them with the steam release.

That is certainly fair. I look forward to it.

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: metalmunki
item.description:
OnboardError:

I think we will address them with the steam release.

That seems like the most sensible idea, tbh. It’ll certainly simplify the patch system as there are still some people who can’t seem to even install the mod.

Will Achievements retroactively convert to Steamworks ones or will we have to get them again? Not that I mind. Any excuse to play it again

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: GordonReturns
item.description:
I feel that people will think every little thing that doesn’t work for them specifically will be a balance bug. “The enemies are too hard!” Devs make them weaker and everyone else complains that they were fine “The mp5 is too inaccurate/weak/strong/real looking/phallic-shaped” Devs do whatever and everyone else complain they were fine if a person with half a brain used them

There are bugs…and then there are petty things that only a portion of the players are noticing. I admit SOME things need looked into but others need ignored or tactfully handled.

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: Langenscheiss
item.description:
Okay, good to read that you are considering a patch! I hope this does not affect the development of Xen too much!

Tree Dude:

Are there other issues people are seeing?

I think the main focus should be on the bugs you named:

  • Performance/Crash issues
  • rebalancing
  • fix collection of minor bugs (like noclipping HECUs, floating arm gibs,…insert a longer list here…)

Maybe, some people should make a collection thread were the bugs are listed including links to the discussion threads but not discussed anymore, so that the devs (and the community) get a concise bug table!

Read full topic

item.title: Sooo... Patch ETA?
item.dc:creator: OnboardError
item.description:
Tree Dude:

Curious if there is a patch inbound for the various issues being reported? If so whats the immediate focus?

The 2 biggest issues I am seeing are performance (especially the least level) and game balance. The balance can be manually changed by the user, so I am not sure if it is going to be considered an issue or not.

The more minor issues I think are the need to jump crouch for everything and the lack of DX8 support (which I am not sure will even be addressed).

Are there other issues people are seeing?

I think we will address them with the steam release.
